about_the_game:
Forge your destiny in Star Life, a space-based economic & strategic RPG simulation. Begin as a humble newcomer on a vibrant alien planet, scraping by with basic jobs or petty crime. Through skillful planning, strategic resource management, and a healthy (or not) dose of risk-taking, climb the economic ladder, mastering skills in a dynamic learn-by-doing system. Will you rise from obscurity to become a galactic tycoon, having enough power to overcome those who led you there?

Every decision carries weight. Mine asteroids, plunder unsuspecting freighters, and engage in lucrative trade across solar system. Each choice has consequences, and mistakes can be fatal. Command your spaceship, manage your resources, and navigate dangerous space . Too dangerous for you? Live a normal life on any planet, until consequences of peaceful life hit hard like a rock.

 For more repetitive tasks utilize the Life Planner to schedule your actions, optimizing your routines for maximum efficiency. Build enterprises, master skills, and grow your wealth on the planet until you are ready to conquer space. Every day is a step toward your ultimate goal, which, funny enough - you do not know.

This single-player sandbox offers unparalleled freedom. Manipulate markets, build new industries, conquer planets, or choose a life of quiet contemplation, focusing on personal growth and community building. Your choices shape the destiny of a solar system. Which path will you choose?

Can't tell you more than this, sorry. Main storyline is vague and optional, it does not restrict you (well, almost) from exploring the world.

content_descriptors.notes:
Game allows freedom of choice while player is on the planet, from working to committing crimes. It is text based content without violent images or graphic description, but it can be done through button clicking. Example is following:

Player clicks on the Button "Discover Historic District", Then clicks on the button "Lonely Citizen" and then options include "Attack (with an attempt to kill)". This is the most criminal act a player can conduct and read about the result in a simple statement whether it was successful attack or not (no description). There are some other criminal acts player can conduct, such as Pickpocket Someone. All criminal acts are marked at the start of the button with [C], described in the tutorial as a mark for Criminal actions. Criminal rating of the player is tracked, and player ends up in prison if commits crime, generally.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5 2.5 GHz / AMD Ryzen 5
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVidia GTX 1050 / AMD RX550
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i7 2.8 GHz / AMD Ryzen 7
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVidia GTX 1080 / AMD RX 5600
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 5 GB available space

short_description: Star Life is a space sandbox RPG where you start on a planet and carve your own path. Develop skills through "learn by doing," influence dynamic economies, schedule your life with the "Life Planner," and face the challenges of space. Balance risk and survival in a universe shaped by your choices.
